NAME: Name
TUTORIAL_SLIDE0_DESCRIPTION: I'm a technologically advanced personal assistant, backed by artificial inteligence, to help live better and be happier. Data science for your greatness
TUTORIAL_SLIDE02_DESCRIPTION: I was built around time-tested principles for conducting a wise, balanced and good life; I combine many popular ideas from Epictetus' maxims, 100 AD, to Stephen Covey's habits. I am a computer-based life-system that will help you thrive, enjoy more and even lead and help others
TUTORIAL_SLIDE021_TITLE: Also, I may help you managing primitive productivity tools
TUTORIAL_SLIDE021_DESCRIPTION: Like most other humans in 2017, you may be using first generation productivity tools, such as Google's Calendar, Email, Docs, Tasks, etc. If you do, I may help you accessing, integrating and managing those tools
TUTORIAL_SLIDE03_TITLE: Ok, let's do a brief conceptual introduction
TUTORIAL_SLIDE03_DESCRIPTION: In the next few slides, I will summarize our system through a series of points keeping a non technical conceptual level.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE1_TITLE: Point 1. Identify everything you care in your life.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE1_DESCRIPTION: We are going to consider everything. Everything you care. To do that I will start by proposing you the areas that most humans like you care about: health, family, your mind, money, friends, work, etc. and then we will add some specific ones for you. Take your time, it's your life
TUTORIAL_SLIDE11_TITLE: Point 2. Organize everything you care into Luckets
TUTORIAL_SLIDE11_DESCRIPTION: A 'Lucket', is a specific isolated 'life bucket' that represents one of those permanent life areas that you plan to care and improve over time. Our predefined Luckets will be fine most of the time but sometimes we will create specifics ones for you.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE111_DESCRIPTION: When done with point 1 and 2, you will have one lucket for anything you care. So, you can forget stuff outside your luckets.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE12_TITLE: Point 3. Order the luckets to define your priorities
TUTORIAL_SLIDE12_DESCRIPTION: All luckets are important but some will be more important to you when things go wrong. There a many ways to define priorities, sometimes is obvious, sometimes is a personal choice. I will propose you some initial order and then we will fine tune it to you
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_TITLE: Point 4. Color code the status of all your luckets
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_DESCRIPTION: Blue is perfection, should stop. Green is pretty good, keep working. Yellow is warning, do something. Red is really bad, do something asap. White is skip or neglect, maybe is ok. Black is tragic, stop everything and do this.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE2_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you want to assess the status of your 'Health' lucket. If you feel fit, flexible, thin and nice but you still need to watch out your diet and your gym, put a green. Good job. If you are 5kg overweight, feel tired and having not going to gym recently put a yellow. If you are 20kgs overweight, have knee pain and cannot stop eating ice cream and smoking for breakfast, put a red. I would not use white here, your call, but neglecting your health is a bad strategy. I hope you never put black in this lucket. That is very sad, but may happen, specially is you do not stop that smoking. If you feel like the Dalai Lama going to the Olympics put a blue.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_TITLE: Point 5. Write activities and goals for the week, month, season, year and beyond
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_DESCRIPTION: Life is about doing things within time frames. Humans on earth work better with sun or moon based time frames and the week is the best unit of planning but life also needs longer perspective, write also for season, a year or and 5 years.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3a_TITLE: Point 6. Size the activities with units and patterns
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3a_DESCRIPTION: Sizing is a critical fine art to plan what to do. Luckets uses a simple, but powerful, way to size using units and pattern like these: 'do 1 hour of gym 3 times a week', 'work at the office 7 hours a day 5 times a week', etc. This point will take some time to master. Be patient.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3a_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3b_TITLE: Point 5. Day by day, pick from your week list
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3b_DESCRIPTION: We will always try, but is hard to perfectly plan a day. Some meetings will be fixed, but the rest should be adaptative. Together, we will intelligently assess our day circumstances and decide what is the best to do from your bucket lists. Carpe diem.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE3b_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_TITLE: Point 6. Day by day, assess your achievements within time frames
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_DESCRIPTION: Similar to circles for lucket status, we use colored squares to show the status of activities within their time frame. The meaning is somehow similar. Blue means 'done', green 'in progress', etc
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4b_TITLE: Point 7. Tell me how much you love that lucket
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4b_DESCRIPTION: Not all luckets are the same when it comes to deal with them. Some thing we care stress us a lot, some of them relax us, some are in the middle. Use color coded triagles to tell me how you feel about it. Blue means love, read means hate
TUTORIAL_SLIDE4b_EXAMPLE: Example: Say you are assessing your action 'do gym for 30 mins 4 days a week'....to be continued
TUTORIAL_SLIDE5_TITLE: Point 8. Tell me how you feel
TUTORIAL_SLIDE5_DESCRIPTION: Humans are cute but complicated. You have feelingsand that greatly impact plans. For every lucket assess: general mood, feeling about circumstances, motivation, energy, focus. social need. Again, we will use a similar color code for this
TUTORIAL_SLIDE5b_DESCRIPTION: This system is not about taking hard decisions and stick to them for a long time. Is about ccontinously re-assesing, thinking, recalculating what is the best. Periodically, every week, or every day, we will re-asses your luckets and adapt to optimize our plan
TUTORIAL_SLIDE6_TITLE: Point 10. Check my reports and advice
TUTORIAL_SLIDE6_DESCRIPTION: Based on the historical data I will be collecting about your luckets, activities, feelings and information about your circunstances I will be continously giving you new advice, new ways to improve. We will be a team.
TUTORIAL_SLIDE_LAST_TITLE: Good job. Now, please, slow down and relax. Press continue when your are ready, maybe tomorrow. Cheers.
